name: DESIGN_ID
description: Design Identification Register

bit_ranges.name: DESIGN_ID
bit_ranges.description:
Design ID code fixed by HDMI that Identifies the
instantiated DWC_hdmi_tx controller. For example,
DWC_hdmi_tx 2.11a, DESIGN_ID = 21

name: REVISION_ID
description: Revision Identification Register

bit_ranges.name: REVISION_ID
bit_ranges.description:
Revision ID code fixed by HDMI that Identifies the
instantiated DWC_hdmi_tx controller.

name: PRODUCT_ID0
description: Product Identification Register 0

bit_ranges.name: PRODUCT_ID0
bit_ranges.description:
This one byte fixed code Identifies HDMI 's product
line ("A0h" for DWC_hdmi_tx products).

name: PRODUCT_ID1
description: Product Identification Register 1

bit_ranges.name: PRODUCT_ID1_HDCP
bit_ranges.description:
These bits identify a HDMI Controller with HDCP
encryption according to HDMI product line.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: PRODUCT_ID1_RX
bit_ranges.description:
This bit Identifies HDMI 's DWC_hdmi_rx Controller
according to HDMI product line.

bit_ranges.name: PRODUCT_ID1_TX
bit_ranges.description:
This bit Identifies H Controller according to HDMI
product line.

name: CONFIG0_ID
description: Configuration Identification Register 0

bit_ranges.name: PREPEN
bit_ranges.description:
Indicates if it is possible to use internal pixel
repetition

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: AUDSPDIF
bit_ranges.description: Indicates if the SPDIF audio interface is present

bit_ranges.name: AUDI2S
bit_ranges.description: Indicates if I2S interface is present

bit_ranges.name: HDMI14
bit_ranges.description: Indicates if HDMI 1.4 features are present

bit_ranges.name: CSC
bit_ranges.description: Indicates if Color Space Conversion block is present

bit_ranges.name: CEC
bit_ranges.description: Indicates if CEC is present

bit_ranges.name: HDCP
bit_ranges.description: Indicates if HDCP is present

name: CONFIG1_ID
description: Configuration Identification Register 1

bit_ranges.name: HDCP22_SNPS
bit_ranges.description: Indicates if HDCP 2.2 SNPS solution is present

bit_ranges.name: HDCP22_EXT
bit_ranges.description:
Indicates if external HDCP 2.2 interface support is
present

bit_ranges.name: HDMI20
bit_ranges.description: Indicates if HDMI 2.0 features are present

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: CONFAPB
bit_ranges.description:
Indicates that configuration interface is APB
interface

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

name: CONFIG2_ID
description: Configuration Identification Register 2

bit_ranges.name: PHYTYPE
bit_ranges.description:
Indicates the type of PHY interface selected: 0x00:
Legacy PHY (HDMI Tx PHY)
0xF2: PHY GEN2 (HDMI 3D TX PHY)
0xE2: PHY GEN2 (HDMI 3D TX PHY) + HEAC PHY
0xC2: PHY MHL COMBO (MHL+HDMI 2.0 TX PHY)
0xB2: PHY MHL COMBO (MHL+HDMI 2.0 TX PHY) +
HEAC PHY
0xF3: PHY HDMI 20 (HDMI 2.0 TX PHY)
0xE3: PHY HDMI 20 (HDMI 2.0 TX PHY) + HEAC PHY
0xFE: External PHY

name: CONFIG3_ID
description: Configuration Identification Register 3

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: CONFAHBAUDDMA
bit_ranges.description: Indicates that the audio interface is AHB AUD DMA

bit_ranges.name: CONFGPAUD
bit_ranges.description:
Indicates that the audio interface is Generic Parallel
Audio (GPAUD)

name: IH_FC_STAT0
description: Frame Composer Interrupt Status Register 0 (Packet Interrupts)

bit_ranges.name: AUDI
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an Audio
InfoFrame packet.

bit_ranges.name: ACP
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an Audio
Content Protection packet.

bit_ranges.name: HBR
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an Audio
HBR packet.

bit_ranges.name: MAS
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an
MultiStream Audio packet

bit_ranges.name: NVBI
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an NTSC
VBI packet

bit_ranges.name: AUDS
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an Audio
Sample packet. Due to high number of audio
sample packets transmitted, this interrupt is by
default masked at frame composer.

bit_ranges.name: ACR
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an Audio
Clock Regeneration (N/ CTS transmission) packet.

bit_ranges.name: NULL
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an Null
packet. Due to high number of audio sample
packets transmitted, this interrupt is by default
masked at frame composer.

name: IH_FC_STAT1
description: Frame Composer Interrupt Status Register 1 (Packet Interrupts)

bit_ranges.name: GMD
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an Gamut
metadata packet.

bit_ranges.name: ISCR1
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an
International Standard Recording Code 1 packet.

bit_ranges.name: ISCR2
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an
International Standard Recording Code 2 packet

bit_ranges.name: VSD
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an Vendor
Specific Data InfoFrame packet.

bit_ranges.name: SPD
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an Source
Product Descriptor InfoFrame packet.

bit_ranges.name: AMP
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an Audio
Metadata packet

bit_ranges.name: AVI
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an AVI
InfoFrame packet.

bit_ranges.name: GCP
bit_ranges.description:
Active after successful transmission of an General
Control Packet.

name: IH_FC_STAT2
description: Frame Composer Interrupt Status Register 2 (Packet Interrupts)

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: DRM

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: LOWPRIORITY_OVERFLOW

bit_ranges.name: HIGHPRIORITY_OVERFLOW

name: IH_AS_STAT0
description:
Audio Sampler Interrupt Status Register (FIFO Threshold, Underflow and
Overflow Interrupts)

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_UNDERRUN
bit_ranges.description: Indicates an underrun on the audio FIFO

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_OVERRUN
bit_ranges.description: Indicates an overrun on the audio FIFO.

bit_ranges.name: AUD_FIFO_UNDERFLOW_THR
bit_ranges.description:
Audio Sampler audio FIFO empty threshold (four
samples) indication for the legacy HBR audio
interface.
For AHB_DMA, this bit indicates that the number of
samples in the FIFO is equal to (or less) than the
number of active audio channels.
This bit is not relevant for I2S, SPDIF, and GPA
interfaces.

bit_ranges.name: AUD_FIFO_UNDERFLOW
bit_ranges.description: Audio Sampler audio FIFO empty indication.

bit_ranges.name: AUD_FIFO_OVERFLOW
bit_ranges.description: Audio Sampler audio FIFO full indication.

name: IH_PHY_STAT0
description:
PHY Interface Interrupt Status Register (RXSENSE, PLL Lock and HPD

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_3
bit_ranges.description:
TX PHY RX_SENSE indication for driver 3. You may
need to mask or change polarity of this interrupt
after it has become active.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_2
bit_ranges.description:
TX PHY RX_SENSE indication for driver 2. You may
need to mask or change polarity of this interrupt
after it has become active.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_1
bit_ranges.description:
TX PHY RX_SENSE indication for driver 1. You may
need to mask or change polarity of this interrupt
after it has become active.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_0
bit_ranges.description:
TX PHY RX_SENSE indication for driver 0. You may
need to mask or change polarity of this interrupt
after it has become active.

bit_ranges.name: TX_PHY_LOCK
bit_ranges.description: TX PHY PLL lock indication.

bit_ranges.name: HPD
bit_ranges.description:
HDMI Hot Plug Detect indication. You may need to
mask or change polarity of this interrupt after it
has become active.

name: IH_MUTE
description: Global Interrupt Mute Control Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: MUTE_WAKEUP_INTERRUPT
bit_ranges.description:
When set to 1, mutes the main interrupt output
port. The sticky bit interrupts continue with their
state accessible through the configuration bus,
only the main interrupt line is muted.

bit_ranges.name: MUTE_ALL_INTERRUPT
bit_ranges.description:
When set to 1, mutes the main interrupt line
(where all interrupts are ORed). The sticky bit
interrupts continue with their state; only the main
interrupt line is muted.

name: TX_INVID0
description: Video Input Mapping and Internal Data Enable Configuration Register

bit_ranges.name: INTERNAL_DE_GENERATOR
bit_ranges.description:
Internal data enable (DE) generator enable. If data
enable is not available for the input video, set this
bit to one to activate the internal data enable
generator.
Attention: This feature only works for input video
modes that have native repetition (such as, all CEA
videos). No desired pixel repetition can be used
with this feature because these configurations only
affect the Frame Composer and not this block.
The DE Generator does not work for the following
conditions:
Transmission of video with CEA VIC 39
Transmission of 3D video using the field
alternative structure

name: TX_INSTUFFING
description: Video Input Stuffing Enable Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: BCBDATA_STUFFING
bit_ranges.description:
0b: When the dataen signal is low, the value in the
bcbdata[15:0] output is the one sampled from the
corresponding input data.
1b: When the dataen signal is low, the value in the
bcbdata[15:0] output is given by the values in the
TX_BCBDTA0 and TX_BCBDATA1 registers.

bit_ranges.name: RCRDATA_STUFFING
bit_ranges.description:
0b: When the dataen signal is low, the value in the
rcrdata[15:0] output is the one sampled from the
corresponding input data.
1b: When the dataen signal is low, the value in the
rcrdata[15:0] output is given by the values in
TX_RCRDTA0 and TX_RCRDATA1 registers.

bit_ranges.name: GYDATA_STUFFING
bit_ranges.description:
0b: When the dataen signal is low, the value in the
gydata[15:0] output is the one sampled from the
corresponding input data.
1b: When the dataen signal is low, the value in the
gydata[15:0] output is given by the values in
TX_GYDTA0 and TX_GYDATA1 registers.

name: TX_GYDATA0
description: Video Input gy Data Channel Stuffing Register 0

bit_ranges.name: GYDATA
bit_ranges.description:
This register defines the value of gydata[7:0]
when TX_INSTUFFING[0] (gydata_stuffing) is set
to 1b.

name: TX_GYDATA1
description: Video Input gy Data Channel Stuffing Register 1

bit_ranges.name: GYDATA
bit_ranges.description:

name: TX_RCRDATA0

name: TX_RCRDATA1

bit_ranges.name: RCRDATA

name: TX_BCBDATA0
description: Video Input bcb Data Channel Stuffing Register 0

name: TX_BCBDATA1
description: Video Input bcb Data Channel Stuffing Register 1

bit_ranges.name: BCBDATA
bit_ranges.description:
This register defines the value of bcbdata[15:8]
when TX_INSTUFFING[2] (bcbdata_stuffing) is set
to 1b.

name: VP_STATUS
description: Video Packetizer Packing Phase Status Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: PACKING_PHASE
bit_ranges.description:
Read only register that holds the "packing phase"
output of the Video Packetizer block.

name: VP_PR_CD
description: Video Packetizer Pixel Repetition and Color Depth Register

bit_ranges.name: COLOR_DEPTH
bit_ranges.description:
The Color depth configuration is described as the
following, with the action stated corresponding to
color_depth[3:0]:
0000b: 24 bits per pixel video (8 bits per
component). 8-bit packing mode.
0001b-0011b: Reserved. Not used.
0100b: 24 bits per pixel video (8 bits per
component). 8-bit packing mode.
0101b: 30 bits per pixel video (10 bits per
component). 10-bit packing mode.
0110b: 36 bits per pixel video (12 bits per
component). 12-bit packing mode.
0111b: 48 bits per pixel video (16 bits per
component). 16-bit packing mode.
Other: Reserved. Not used.

bit_ranges.name: DESIRED_PR_FACTOR
bit_ranges.description:
Desired pixel repetition factor configuration. The
configured value sets H13T PHY PLL to multiply
pixel clock by the factor in order to obtain the
desired repetition clock. For the CEA modes some
are already defined with pixel repetition in the
input video. So for CEA modes this shall be always
0. Shall only be used if the user wants to do pixel
repetition using H13TCTRL controller.
The action is stated corresponding to
desired_pr_factor[3:0]:
0000b: No pixel repetition (pixel sent only once)
0001b: Pixel sent two times (pixel repeated once)
0010b: Pixel sent three times
0011b: Pixel sent four times
0100b: Pixel sent five times
0101b: Pixel sent six times
0110b: Pixel sent seven times
0111b: Pixel sent eight times
1000b: Pixel sent nine times
1001b: Pixel sent 10 times
Other: Reserved. Not used

name: VP_STUFF
description: Video Packetizer Stuffing and Default Packing Phase Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: IDEFAULT_PHASE
bit_ranges.description:
Controls the default phase packing machine used
according to HDMI 1.4b specification:
"If the transmitted video format has timing such
that the phase of the first pixel of every Video
Data Period corresponds to pixel packing phase 0
(e.g. 10P0, 12P0, 16P0), the Source may set the
Default_Phase bit in the GCP. The Sink may use
this bit to optimize its filtering or handling of the
PP field."
This means that for 10-bit mode the Htotal must
be dividable by 4; for 12- bit mode, the Htotal
must be divisible by 2.

bit_ranges.name: IFIX_PP_TO_LAST
bit_ranges.description: Reserved. Controls packing machine strategy

bit_ranges.name: ICX_GOTO_P0_ST
bit_ranges.description: Reserved. Controls packing machine strategy

bit_ranges.name: YCC422_STUFFING
bit_ranges.description:
YCC 422 remap stuffing control. For horizontal
blanking, the action is stated corresponding to
ycc422_stuffing:
0b: YCC 422 remap block in direct mode (input
blanking data goes directly to output).
1b: YCC 422 remap block in stuffing mode. When
"de" goes to low the outputs are fixed to 0x00.

bit_ranges.name: PP_STUFFING
bit_ranges.description:
Pixel packing stuffing control. The action is stated
corresponding to pp_stuffing:
0b: Pixel packing block in direct mode (input
blanking data goes directly to output).
1b: Pixel packing block in stuffing mode. When
"de_rep" goes to low the outputs are fixed to
0x00.

name: VP_REMAP
description: Video Packetizer YCC422 Remapping Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: YCC422_SIZE
bit_ranges.description:
YCC 422 remap input video size ycc422_size[1:0]
00b: YCC 422 16-bit input video (8 bits per
component) 01b: YCC 422 20-bit input video (10
bits per component) 10b: YCC 422 24-bit input
video (12 bits per component) 11b: Reserved. Not
used

name: VP_CONF
description: Video Packetizer Output and Enable Configuration Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: BYPASS_EN
bit_ranges.description:
When set to 1'b1, Pixel packing enable. When set
to 1b'0, the pixel packing block is controlled by
pp_en.

bit_ranges.name: PP_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Pixel packing enable. When set to 0, the pixel
packing block is disabled if bypass_en is 1’b0.

bit_ranges.name: PR_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Pixel repeater enable. When set to 0, the pixel
repetition block is disabled.

bit_ranges.name: YCC422_EN
bit_ranges.description:
YCC 422 select enable. Disabling forces bypass
module to output always zeros.

bit_ranges.name: BYPASS_SELECT
bit_ranges.description:
bypass_select
0b: Data from pixel repeater block
1b: Data from input of Video Packetizer block

bit_ranges.name: OUTPUT_SELECTOR
bit_ranges.description: When set to 1'b1, Data from pixel packing block.

bit_ranges.name: OUTPUT_SELECTOR_0
bit_ranges.description:
Video Packetizer output selection 0b: Data from
pixel packing block 1b: Data from YCC422 remap
block

name: FC_EXCTRLSPAC
description: Frame Composer Extended Control Period Maximum Spacing Register

bit_ranges.name: EXCTRLPERIODSPACING
bit_ranges.description:
Configuration of the maximum spacing between
consecutive extended control periods (maximum of
50ms; refer to the applicable HDMI specification).
When using the HDMI 2.0 supported features
(HDMI_TX_20 = 1):
generated spacing = (1/freq tmds
clock)*256*512*(extctrlperiodspacing +1)
else
generated spacing = (1/freq tmds
clock)*256*256*(extctrlperiodspacing +1)

name: FC_DATAUTO0
description:
Frame Composer Data Island Auto Packet Scheduling Register 0
Configures the Frame Composer RDRB(1)/Manual(0) data island packet insertion for SPD,
VSD, ISRC2, ISRC1 and ACP packets. On RDRB mode the described packet scheduling is
controlled by registers FC_DATAUTO1 and FC_DATAUTO2, while in Manual mode register
FC_DATMAN requests to FC the insertion of the requested packet.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: SPD_AUTO
bit_ranges.description: Enables SPD automatic packet scheduling

bit_ranges.name: VSD_AUTO
bit_ranges.description: Enables VSD automatic packet scheduling

bit_ranges.name: ISCR2_AUTO
bit_ranges.description: Enables ISRC2 automatic packet scheduling

bit_ranges.name: ISCR1_AUTO
bit_ranges.description: Enables ISRC1 automatic packet scheduling

bit_ranges.name: ACP_AUTO
bit_ranges.description: Enables ACP automatic packet scheduling

name: FC_DATAUTO1
description:
Frame Composer Data Island Auto Packet Scheduling Register 1
Configures the Frame Composer (FC) RDRB frame interpolation for SPD, VSD, ISRC2,
ISRC1 and ACP packet insertion on data island when FC is on RDRB mode for the listed
packets.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name:
AUTO_FRAME_INTERPOLATI
ON
bit_ranges.description:
Packet frame interpolation for automatic packet
scheduling

name: FC_DATAUTO2
description:
Frame Composer Data Island Auto packet scheduling Register 2
Configures the Frame Composer (FC) RDRB line interpolation and number of packets in
frame for SPD, VSD, ISRC2, ISRC1 and ACP packet insertion on data island when FC is on
RDRB mode for the listed packets.

bit_ranges.name: AUTO_FRAME_PACKETS
bit_ranges.description: Packets per frame, for automatic packet scheduling

bit_ranges.name: AUTO_LINE_SPACING
bit_ranges.description:
Packets line spacing, for automatic packet
scheduling

name: FC_DATMAN
description:
Frame Composer Data Island Manual Packet Request Register
Requests to the Frame Composer the data island packet insertion for NULL, SPD, VSD,
ISRC2, ISRC1 and ACP packets when FC_DATAUTO0 bit is in manual mode for the packet
requested.

bit_ranges.name: SPD_TX

name: FC_PRCONF
description: Frame Composer Pixel Repetition Configuration Register

bit_ranges.name: INCOMING_PR_FACTOR
bit_ranges.description:
Configures the input video pixel repetition. For CEA
modes, this value must be extracted from the CEA
specification for the video mode being input.
incoming_pr_factor[3:0] 0000b: No action. Not
used.
0001b: No pixel repetition (pixel sent only once)
0010b: Pixel sent two times (pixel repeated once)
0011b: Pixel sent three times
0100b: Pixel sent four times 0101b: Pixel sent five
times 0110b: Pixel sent six times 0111b: Pixel sent
seven times 1000b: Pixel sent eight times 1001b:
Pixel sent nine times 1010b: Pixel sent 10 times
Other: Reserved. Not used

bit_ranges.name: OUTPUT_PR_FACTOR
bit_ranges.description:
Configures the video pixel repetition ratio to be sent
on the AVI InfoFrame. This value must be valid
according to the HDMI specification. The
output_pr_factor = incoming_pr_factor *
(desired_pr_factor + 1) – 1.
output_pr_factor[3:0] 0000b: No action. Not used.
0001b: Pixel sent two times (pixel repeated once)
0010b: Pixel sent three times
0011b: Pixel sent four times 0100b: Pixel sent five
times 0101b: Pixel sent six times 0110b: Pixel sent
seven times 0111b: Pixel sent eight times 1000b:
Pixel sent nine times 1001b: Pixel sent 10 times
Other: Reserved. Not used
Note: When working in YCC422 video, the actual
repetition of the stream is Incoming_pr_factor *
(desired_pr_factor + 1). This calculation is done
internally in the H13TCTRL and no hardware
overflow protection is available. Care must be taken
to avoid this result passes the maximum number of
10 pixels repeated because no HDMI support is
available for this in the specification and the
H13TPHY does not support this higher repetition
values.

name: FC_SCRAMBLER_CTRL
description: Frame Composer Scrambler Control

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: SCRAMBLER_UCP_LINE
bit_ranges.description:
Debug register. When active (1'b1), the
Unscrambled Control Period is generated after each
active video line (non-compliant behavior). This is
quasi-static field which requires a a
mc_swrstzreq.tmdsswrst_req reset request to be
performed after the change of this configuration bit.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: SCRAMBLER_ON
bit_ranges.description:
When set (1'b1), this field activates the HDMI 2.0
scrambler feature. When disabled (1'b0) the
scrambler feature is bypassed, placing Hdmi_tx in
HDMI 1.4b compatible mode. To activate the
scrambler feature, you must ensure that the quasi-
static
configuration bit fc_invidconf.HDCP_keepout is set
(1'b1) at configuration time, before the required
mc_swrstzreq.tmdsswrst_req reset request is
issued.
This is field can be changed in runtime.

This field, when set (1'b1), activates the HDMI 2.0
Multi- Stream support. The audio stream present at
the input of the Hdmi_tx controller is transported
using Multi-Stream Audio Sample Packets.

name: FC_GMD_STAT
description:
Frame Composer GMD Packet Status Register
Gamut metadata packet status bit information for no_current_gmd, next_gmd_field,
gmd_packet_sequence and current_gamut_seq_num. For more information, refer to the
HDMI 1.4b specification.

bit_ranges.name: IGMDNO_CRNT_GBD
bit_ranges.description: Gamut scheduling: No current gamut data

bit_ranges.name: IGMDDNEXT_FIELD
bit_ranges.description: Gamut scheduling: Gamut Next field

bit_ranges.name: IGMDPACKET_SEQ
bit_ranges.description: Gamut scheduling: Gamut packet sequence

bit_ranges.name:
IGMDCURRENT_GAMUT_SE
Q_NUM
bit_ranges.description:
Gamut scheduling: Current Gamut packet sequence
number

name: FC_GMD_EN
description:
Frame Composer GMD Packet Enable Register
This register enables Gamut metadata (GMD) packet transmission. Packets are inserted in
the incoming frame, starting in the line where active Vsync indication starts. After enable of
GMD packets the outgoing packet is sent with no_current_gmd active indication until
update GMD request is performed in the controller.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: GMDENABLETX
bit_ranges.description: Gamut Metadata packet transmission enable (1b)

name: FC_GMD_UP
description:
Frame Composer GMD Packet Update Register
This register performs an GMD packet content update according to the configured packet
body (FC_GMD_PB0 to FC_GMD_PB27) and packet header (FC_GMD_HB). This active high
auto clear register reflects the body and header configurations on the GMD packets sent
arbitrating the current_gamut_seq_num, gmd_packet_sequence and next_gmd_field bits
on packet to correctly indicate to source the Gamut change to be performed. After enable
GMD packets the first update request is also responsible for deactivating the
no_current_gmd indication bit.
Attention packet update request must only be done after correct configuration of GMD
packet body and header registers. Correct affected_gamut_seq_num and gmd_profile
configuration is user responsibility and must convey with HDMI 1.4b standard gamut rules.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: GMDUPDATEPACKET
bit_ranges.description: Gamut Metadata packet update

name: FC_GMD_CONF
description:
Frame Composer GMD Packet Schedule Configuration Register
This register configures the number of GMD packets to be inserted per frame (starting
always in the line where the active Vsync appears) and the line spacing between the
transmitted GMD packets.
Note that for profile P0 (refer to the HDMI 1.4b specification) this register should only
indicate one GMD packet to be inserted per video field.

bit_ranges.name: GMDPACKETSINFRAME
bit_ranges.description:
Number of GMD packets per frame or video field
(profile P0)

bit_ranges.name: GMDPACKETLINESPACING
bit_ranges.description:
Number of line spacing between the transmitted
GMD packets

name: FC_GMD_HB
description:
Frame Composer GMD Packet Profile and Gamut Sequence Configuration
Register
This register configures the GMD packet header affected_gamut_seq_num and gmd_profile
bits. For more information, refer to the HDMI 1.4b specification.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: GMDGBD_PROFILE
bit_ranges.description:
GMD profile bits. Hdmi_tx only supports Profile 0
(P0) of the Gamut Boundary Description Metadata
Profiles described in the HDMI 1.4 Specification
(which defines four profiles, P0-P4).

bit_ranges.name:
GMDAFFECTED_GAMUT_SE
Q_NUM
bit_ranges.description: Affected gamut sequence number

description:
Frame Composer TMDS Data Channel Register Array
Configures the video fixed data to be used in TMDS channel x (where x is 0 to 2) when in
fixed video selection.
For Channel 0, this equals to set B pixel component value in RGB video or Cb pixel
component value in YCbCr.
For Channel 1, this equals set G pixel component value in RGB video or Y pixel component
value in YCbCr.
For Channel 2, this equals to set R pixel component value in RGB video or Cr pixel
component value in YCbCr.

name: PHY_STAT0
description:
PHY RXSENSE, PLL Lock, and HPD Status Register
This register contains the following active high packet sent status indications.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_3
bit_ranges.description:
Status bit. TX PHY RX_SENSE indication for TMDS
channel 3 driver. You may need to mask or change
polarity of this interrupt after it has became active.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_2
bit_ranges.description:
Status bit. TX PHY RX_SENSE indication for TMDS
channel 2 driver. You may need to mask or change
polarity of this interrupt after it has became active.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_1
bit_ranges.description:
Status bit. TX PHY RX_SENSE indication for TMDS
channel 1 driver. You may need to mask or change
polarity of this interrupt after it has became active.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_0
bit_ranges.description:
Status bit. TX PHY RX_SENSE indication for TMDS
channel 0 driver. You may need to mask or change
polarity of this interrupt after it has became active.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: HPD
bit_ranges.description:
Status bit. HDMI Hot Plug Detect indication. You may
need to mask or change polarity of this interrupt
after it has became active.

bit_ranges.name: TX_PHY_LOCK
bit_ranges.description:
Status bit. TX PHY PLL lock indication. You may need
to mask or change polarity of this interrupt after it
has became active.

name: PHY_INT0
description:
PHY RXSENSE, PLL Lock, and HPD Interrupt Register
This register contains the interrupt indication of the PHY_STAT0 status interrupts. Interrupt
generation is accomplished in the following way:
interrupt = (mask == 1'b0) && (polarity == status);
All these interrupts are forwarded to the Interrupt Handler sticky bit register ih_phy_stat0
and after ORed to a single main interrupt line to micro controller. Assertion of this interrupt
implies that data related with the corresponding packet has been sent through the HDMI
interface.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_3
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt indication bit. TX PHY RX_SENSE indication
interruption for TMDS CLK driver.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_2
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt indication bit. TX PHY RX_SENSE indication
interruption for TMDS channel 2 driver.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_1
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt indication bit. TX PHY RX_SENSE indication
interruption for TMDS channel 1 driver.

bit_ranges.name: RX_SENSE_0
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt indication bit. TX PHY RX_SENSE indication
interruption for TMDS channel 0 driver.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: HPD
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt indication bit. HDMI Hot Plug Detect
indication interrupt.

bit_ranges.name: TX_PHY_LOCK
bit_ranges.description:
Interrupt indication bit. TX PHY PLL lock indication
interrupt.

Operation done interrupt bit. Only lasts for 1 SFR
clock cycle and is auto cleared after it.
{done_interrupt = (done_mask==0b) &&
(done_status==done_pol)}

Not acknowledge error interrupt bit. Only lasts for

{nack_interrupt = (nack_mask==0b) &&

Note: This bit field is read by the sticky bits present
on the ih_i2cmphy_stat0 register.

name: AUD_CONF0
description:
Audio I2S Software FIFO Reset, Select, and Enable Control Register 0
This register configures the I2S input enable that indicates which input I2S channels have
valid data. It also allows the system processor to reset audio FIFOs upon
underflow/overflow error detection.

bit_ranges.name: SW_AUDIO_FIFO_RST
bit_ranges.description:
Audio FIFOs software reset
Writing 0b: no action taken
Writing 1b: Resets all audio FIFOs Reading from this
register always returns 0b.
Note: If a FIFO reset request (via SFR command)
lands in the middle
of an I2S transaction, the samples become
misaligned (left-right sequence lost). As a solution,
for each FIFO reset, an associated I2S reset must be
issued (writing 8'hF7 to MC_SWRSTZ register).

bit_ranges.name: SPARE_2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved as "spare" bit with no associated
functionality.

bit_ranges.name: I2S_SELECT
bit_ranges.description:
1b: Selects I2S Audio Interface 0b: Selects the
second (SPDIF/GPA) interface, in configurations with
more that one audio interface (DOUBLE/GDOUBLE)

bit_ranges.name: SPARE_1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved as "spare" bit with no associated
functionality.

bit_ranges.name: I2S_IN_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Action
I2S_in_en[0] - I2Sdata[0] enable I2S_in_en[1] -
I2Sdata[1] enable I2S_in_en[2] - I2Sdata[2] enable
I2S_in_en[3] - I2Sdata[3] enable

name: AUD_CONF1
description:
Audio I2S Width Configuration Register 1 This register configures the data
width of the input data.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: I2S_WIDTH
bit_ranges.description:
I2S input data width I2S_width[4:0] | Action
00000b-01111b | Not used
10000b | 16 bit data samples at input
10001b | 17 bit data samples at input
10010b | 18 bit data samples at input
10011b | 19 bit data samples at input
10100b | 20 bit data samples at input
10101b | 21 bit data samples at input
10110b | 22 bit data samples at input
10111b | 23 bit data samples at input
11000b | 24 bit data samples at input 11001b-
11111b | Not Used

name: AUD_INT
description:
I2S FIFO status and interrupts.
This register configures the I2S FIFO status and interrupts.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_EMPTY_MASK
bit_ranges.description: FIFO empty mask.

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_FULL_MASK
bit_ranges.description: FIFO full mask.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

name: AUD_CONF2
description:
Audio I2S PCUV, NLPCM and HBR configuration Register 2
This register configures the I2S Audio Data mapping. By default, audio data mapping is the
standard I2S Linear PCM (L-PCM) mapping. You can choose to use the I2S interface to
transport HBR or Non- Linear PCM (NL-PCM) audio, by setting the relevant bit in this
register.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: INSERT_PCUV
bit_ranges.description:
When set (1'b1), this bit enables the insertion of the
PCUV (Parity, Channel Status, User bit and Validity)
bits on the incoming audio stream (support limited to
Linear PCM audio). If disabled, the incoming audio
stream must contain the PCUV bits, mapped
according to Databook.

bit_ranges.name: NLPCM
bit_ranges.description:
I2S NLPCM Mode Enable. When enabled, this bit
assumes that PCUV data is included on the I2S audio
stream according to the description located in the
"I2S Interface" section of Chapter 2, "Functional
Description."

bit_ranges.name: HBR
bit_ranges.description:
I2S HBR Mode Enable. When enabled, the I2S audio
stream is transmitted using HBR packets.

name: AUD_N1
description:
Audio Clock Regenerator N Value Register 1 For N expected values, refer to
the HDMI 1.4b specification.

bit_ranges.name: AUDN
bit_ranges.description: HDMI Audio Clock Regenerator N value

name: AUD_N2
description:
Audio Clock Regenerator N Value Register 2 For N expected values, refer to
the HDMI 1.4b specification.

bit_ranges.name: AUDN
bit_ranges.description: HDMI Audio Clock Regenerator N value

name: AUD_N3
description:
Audio Clock Regenerator N Value Register 3 For N expected values, refer to
the HDMI 1.4b specification.

bit_ranges.name: NCTS_ATOMIC_WRITE
bit_ranges.description:
When set, the new N and CTS values are only used
when aud_n1 register is written. If clear, N and CTS
data is updated each time a new N or CTS byte is
written.
The following write sequence is recommended:
aud_n3 (set bit ncts_atomic_write if desired)
aud_cts3 (set CTS_manual and CTS value if
desired/enabled)
aud_cts2 (required in CTS_manual)
aud_cts1 (required in CTS_manual)
aud_n3 (bit ncts_atomic_write with same value as in
step 1.)
aud_n2
aud_n1
For dynamic N/CTS changes, perform only steps
from 2-7 or 5-7 depending on the state of
CTS_manual.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: AUDN
bit_ranges.description: HDMI Audio Clock Regenerator N value

name: AUD_CTS1
description:
Audio Clock Regenerator CTS Value Register 1 For CTS expected values, refer
to the HDMI 1.4b specification.

bit_ranges.name: AUDCTS
bit_ranges.description:
HDMI Audio Clock Regenerator CTS calculated value.
This value can be manually set using the CTS_manual
(AUD_CTS3) mechanism.

name: AUD_CTS2
description:
Audio Clock Regenerator CTS Register 2
For CTS expected values, refer to the HDMI 1.4b specification.

bit_ranges.name: AUDCTS
bit_ranges.description:
HDMI Audio Clock Regenerator CTS calculated value.
This value can be manually set using the CTS_manual
(AUD_CTS3) mechanism.

name: AUD_CTS3
description:
Audio Clock Regenerator CTS value Register 3. For CTS expected values, refer
to the HDMI 1.4b specification.

bit_ranges.name: SPARE_BITS
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved as "spare" bits with no associated
functionality.

bit_ranges.name: CTS_MANUAL
bit_ranges.description:
If the CTS_manual bit equals 0b, this registers
contains audCTS[19:0] generated by the Cycle time
counter according to the specified timing. If the
CTS_manual bit equals 1b, this register is configured
with the audCTS[7:0] value that is output by the
Audio Packetizer.
Note: When the General Parallel Audio Interface
(GPAUD) is enabled (AUDIO_IF = 6) or the AHB DMA
Audio Interface is enabled (AUDIO_IF = 8), writing to
these bits has no effect; reading these bits always
return 0.

bit_ranges.name: AUDCTS
bit_ranges.description:
HDMI Audio Clock Regenerator CTS calculated value.
This value can be manually set using the CTS_manual
(AUD_CTS3) mechanism.

name: AUD_INPUTCLKFS
description: Audio Input Clock FS Factor Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: IFSFACTOR
bit_ranges.description:
Fs factor configuration:
ifsfactor[2:0] | Audio Clock | Action
0 | 128xFs | If you select the Bypass SPDIF
DRU unit in coreConsultant, the input audio clock
(either I2S or SPDIF according to configuration) is
used at the audio packetizer to calculate the CTS
value and ACR packet insertion rate.
| 256xFs | The input audio clock (I2S only) is
divided by 2 and then used at audio packetizer to
calculate the CTS value and ACR packet insertion
rate.
| 512xFs | The input audio clock (either I2S or
SPDIF according to configuration) used divided by 4
and then used at the audio packetizer to calculate the
CTS value and ACR packet insertion rate.
Note: When the SPDIF interface is receiving an HBR
audio stream ("Support for HBR over SDPIF"
parameter must be enabled), it is required that the
selected IFSFACTOR to be set at 512xFs in order to
comply with the HDMI ACR requirements for HBR
audio streams.
| Reserved
| 64xFs | The input audio clock (I2S only) is
multiplied by 2 and then used at the audio packetizer
to calculate the CTS value and ACR packet insertion
rate.
others | 128xFs | If you select the Bypass SPDIF
DRU unit in coreConsultant, the input audio clock
(either I2S or SPDIF according to configuration) is
used at the audio packetizer to calculate the CTS
value and ACR packet insertion rate.
The SPDIF interface, for non HBR audio, requires that
the configured oversampling value to be 128xFs when
HTX_SPDIFBYPDRU is enabled and 512xFs if not.
When the SPDIF interface is receiving HBR audio
(HBR_ON_SPDIF must be enabled), in order to
comply with the HDMI ACR requirements for HBR
audio streams.

name: AUD_CTS_DITHER
description: Audio CTS Dither Register

bit_ranges.name: DIVISOR
bit_ranges.description:
Dither divisor (4'd1 if no CTS Dither). This field
should be configured with the value of divisor from
the HDMI specification.

bit_ranges.name: DIVIDEND
bit_ranges.description:
Dither dividend (4'd1 if no CTS Dither). This field
should be configured with the value of dividend from
the HDMI specification.

name: AUD_SPDIF0
description:
Audio SPDIF Software FIFO Reset Control Register 0
This register allows the system processor to reset audio FIFOs upon underflow/overflow
error detection.

bit_ranges.name: SW_AUDIO_FIFO_RST
bit_ranges.description:
Audio FIFOs software reset Writing 0b: no action
taken
Writing 1b: Resets all audio FIFOs
Reading from this register always returns 0b.
Note: If a FIFO reset request (via register write
command) lands in the middle of an SPDIF audio
transaction, the samples become misaligned (left-
right sequence lost). As a solution, for each FIFO
reset, an associated SPDIF reset must be issued
(writing 8'hEF to MC_SWRSTZ register).

bit_ranges.name: SPARE
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved as "spare" bit with no associated
functionality.

name: AUD_SPDIF1
description:
Audio SPDIF NLPCM and Width Configuration Register 1 This register
configures the SPDIF data width.

bit_ranges.name: SETNLPCM
bit_ranges.description: Select Non-Linear (1b) / Linear (0b) PCM mode

bit_ranges.name: SPDIF_HBR_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
When set to 1'b1, this bit field indicates that the input
stream has a High Bit Rate (HBR) to be transmitted in
HDMI HBR packets. When clear (1b'0), the audio is
transmitted in HDMI AUDS packets.Note:< Otherwise,
this field is a "spare" bit with no associated
functionality.

name: AUD_SPDIFINT
description: Audio SPDIF FIFO Empty/Full Mask Register

bit_ranges.name: SPDIF_FIFO_FULL_MASK
bit_ranges.description: Description: SPDIF FIFO full mask

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

Audio SPDIF Mask Interrupt Register 1

bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

name: AUD_SPDIF2
description:
Audio SPDIF Enable Confiiguration Register 2
This register configures the SPDIF input enable that indicates which input SPDIF channels
have valid data.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: SPDIF_IN_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Action
SPDIF_in_en[0] - ispdifdata[0] enable SPDIF_in_en[1]
- ispdifdata[1] enable SPDIF_in_en[2] - ispdifdata[2]
enable SPDIF_in_en[3] - ispdifdata[3] enable

name: GP_CONF0
description: Audio GPA Software FIFO Reset Control Register 0

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: SW_AUDIO_FIFO_RST
bit_ranges.description:
Audio FIFOs software reset
Writing 0b: no action taken
Writing 1b: Resets all audio FIFOs Reading from this
register always returns 0b.
Note: If a FIFO reset request (via register write
command) lands in the
middle of an GPAUD audio transaction, the samples
become misaligned (left-right sequence lost). As a
solution, for each FIFO reset, an associated SPDIF
reset must be issued (writing 8'h7F to MC_SWRSTZ
register).

name: GP_CONF1
description: Audio GPA Channel Enable Configuration Register 1

bit_ranges.name: CH_IN_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Each bit controls the enabling of the respective audio
channel. For instance, bit 1, when set (1'b1), the
audio Channel 1 is enabled. When cleared, the
referred channel is disabled.

name: GP_CONF2
description: Audio GPA HBR Enable Register 2

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: INSERT_PCUV
bit_ranges.description:
When set (1'b1), this bit enables the insertion of the
PCUV (Parity, Channel Status, User bit and Validity)
bits on the incoming audio stream (support limited to
Linear PCM audio). If disabled, the incoming audio
stream must contain the PCUV bits, mapped according
to 2.6.4.2 Data Mapping Examples.

bit_ranges.name: HBR
bit_ranges.description:
HBR packets enable. The Hdmi_tx sends the HBR
packets. This bit is enabled when the audio frequency
is higher than 192 kHz. If this bit is enabled, the
number of channels configured in GP_CONF1 must be
set to 8'hFF.

name: GP_MASK
description: Audio GPA FIFO Full and Empty Mask Interrupt Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_OVERRUN_MASK
bit_ranges.description: FIFO overrun mask

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_EMPTY_MASK
bit_ranges.description: FIFO empty flag mask

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_FULL_MASK
bit_ranges.description: FIFO full flag mask

name: AHB_DMA_CONF0
description:
Audio DMA SW FIFO reset and DMA Configuration Register 0
This register contains the software reset bit for the audio FIFOs. It also configures
operating modes of the AHB master.

bit_ranges.name: SW_FIFO_RST
bit_ranges.description:
This is the software reset bit for the audio and FIFO
clear.
Writing 0'b does not result in any action.
Writing 1'b to this register resets all audio FIFOs.
Reading from this register always returns 0'b.

bit_ranges.name: INSERT_PCUV
bit_ranges.description: Enables the insertion of PCUV data

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: HBR
bit_ranges.description:
HBR packet enable
The Hdmi_tx sends the HBR packets. This bit must be
enabled when transmitting non-linear audio of frequency
higher than 192 kHz. If this bit is enabled, the number of
channels configured in AHB_DMA_CONF1 is always 8.

bit_ranges.name: ENABLE_HLOCK
bit_ranges.description:
Enable request of locked burst AHB mechanism.
1'b: Enables the usage of hlock for master request to
arbiter of a locked complete burst.
0'b: Disables request of locked burst AHB mechanism

bit_ranges.name: INCR_TYPE
bit_ranges.description:
Selects the preferred burst length size
00'b: Corresponds to INCR4 fixed four beat, incremental
AHB burst mode. Only valid when burst_mode is high.
01'b: Corresponds to INCR8 fixed eight beat incremental
AHB burst mode. Only valid when burst_mode is high.
10'b: Corresponds to INCR16 fixed 16 beat incremental
AHB burst mode. Only valid when burst_mode is high.
11'b: Corresponds to INCR16 fixed 16 beat incremental
AHB burst mode. Only valid when burst_mode is high.

bit_ranges.name: BURST_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
1'b: Forces the burst mode to be fixed beat, incremental
burst mode designated by the incr_type[1:0] signal.
0'b: Normal operation is unspecified length, incremental
burst. It corresponds to INCR AHB burst mode.

name: AHB_DMA_START
description:
Audio DMA Start Register
The start_dma_transaction bit field signals the AHB audio DMA to start accessing system
memory in order to fetch data samples to store in the FIFO. After the operation starts, a
new request for a DMA start is ignored until the DMA is stopped or it reaches the end
address. Only in one of these situations is a new start request acknowledged.
The first DMA burst request after start_dma_transaction configuration uses
initial_addr[31:0] as ohaddr[31:0] value; mburstlength[8:0] is set to the maximum
admissible value. This maximum value is constrained by the size of buffer provided, the
instantiated FIFO depth, or/and the number of words up to the next 1 Kbyte boundary.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: START_DMA_TRANSACTION
bit_ranges.description:
Start DMA transaction
This register is auto-cleared when the transfer operation
is completed (done).

name: AHB_DMA_STOP
description:
Audio DMA Stop Register
The stop_dma_transaction bit field signals the AHB audio DMA to stop current Attr. After it
stops, if a new start DMA operation is requested, the DMA engine restarts the Attr using
the initial_addr[31:0], which is programmed at ahb_dma_straddr0 to ahb_dma_straddr3.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: STOP_DMA_TRANSACTION
bit_ranges.description:
Stop DMA transaction
This register is auto-cleared when the transfer operation
is stopped (done).

name: AHB_DMA_THRSLD
description:
Audio DMA FIFO Threshold Register
This register defines the FIFO medium threshold occupation value.
After the AHB master completes a burst transaction successfully, the FIFO may remain full
till the data fetch interface requests samples. Each data fetch operation reduces the
number of samples stored in the FIFO by the number of channels enabled.
Therefore, the fifo_threshold[7:0] is the medium number of samples that should be
available in the audio FIFO across the DMA operation.
As soon as the number of samples in the FIFO drops lower than the fifo_threshold[7:0], the
DMA engine requests a new burst of samples for the AHB master. The length is constrained
by the size of buffer provided, the instantiated FIFO depth minus fifo_threshold[7:0],
and/or the number of words up to the next 1 kbyte boundary.

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_THRESHOLD
bit_ranges.description: FIFO medium threshold occupation value

name: AHB_DMA_STRADDR_SET0[0:3]
description:
Audio DMA Start Address Set0 Register Array Address offset: i = 0 to 3
These registers define the initial_addr[31:0] used to initiate the DMA burst read
transactions upon start_dma_transaction configuration.

bit_ranges.name: INITIAL_ADDR
bit_ranges.description: Defines init_addr[7:0] to initiate DMA burst transactions

name: AHB_DMA_STPADDR_SET0[0:3]
description:
Audio DMA Stop Address Set0 Register Array Address offset: i = 0 to 3
This registers define the final_addr[31:0] used as the final point to the DMA burst read
transactions.
Upon start_dma_transaction configuration, the DMA engine starts requesting burst reads
from the external system memory. Each burst read can have a maximum theoretical length
of 256 words (due to the AMBA AHB specification 1 Kbyte boundary burst limitation).
The DMA engine is responsible for incrementing the burst starting address and defining its
corresponding burst length to reach the final_addr[31:0] address. The last burst request
issued by the DMA engine takes into account that it should only request data until the
final_addr[31:0] address (included) and for that should calculate the correct burst length.
After reaching the final_addr[31:0] address, the done interrupt is active to signal
completion of DMA operation.

bit_ranges.name: FINAL_ADDR
bit_ranges.description: Defines final_addr[7:0] to end DMA burst transactions

name: AHB_DMA_BSTRADDR[0:3]
description:
Audio DMA Burst Start Address Register Array Address offset: i = 0 to 3
These read-only registers compose the start address of the current burst operation.
burst_start_addr[31:0] = haddr[31:0] = initial_addr[31:0] + 16.

bit_ranges.name: BURST_ADDR
bit_ranges.description: Start address for the current burst operation

name: AHB_DMA_MBLENGTH0
description:
Audio DMA Burst Length Register 0
This registers holds the length of the current burst operation. As an example, if the first
burst transaction of the AHB audio DMA is a length of 8, then the second burst should start
at address ohaddr[31:0] = initial_addr[31:0] + 32.

bit_ranges.name: MBURSTLENGTH
bit_ranges.description: Requested burst length (mburstlength[7:0])

name: AHB_DMA_MBLENGTH1
description:
Audio DMA Burst Length Register 1
This registers holds the length of the current burst operation. As an example, if the first
burst transaction of the AHB audio DMA is a length of 8, then the second burst should start
at address ohaddr[31:0] = initial_addr[31:0] + 32.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: MBURSTLENGTH
bit_ranges.description: Requested burst length

name: AHB_DMA_MASK
description:
Audio DMA Mask Interrupt Register
This register masks each of the interrupts present in the AHB audio DMA module.

bit_ranges.name: DONE_MASK
bit_ranges.description:
DMA end of operation interrupt mask. Active when DMA
engine reaches final_addr[15:0] or when stop DMA
operation is activated.

bit_ranges.name: RETRYSPLIT_MASK
bit_ranges.description:
Retry/split interrupt mask. Active when AHB master
receives a RETRY or SPLIT response from slave.

bit_ranges.name: LOSTOWNERSHIP_MASK
bit_ranges.description:
Master lost ownership interrupt mask when in burst
transfer. Active when AHB master loses BUS ownership
within the course of a burst transfer.

bit_ranges.name: ERROR_MASK
bit_ranges.description:
Error interrupt mask. Active when slave indicates error
through the isresp[1:0].

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_THREMPTY_MASK
bit_ranges.description:
Audio FIFO empty interrupt mask when audio FIFO has
less than the number of enabled audio channels.

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_FULL_MASK
bit_ranges.description: Audio FIFO full interrupt mask.

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_EMPTY_MASK
bit_ranges.description: Audio FIFO empty interrupt mask.

name: AHB_DMA_CONF1
description:
Audio DMA Channel Enable Configuration Register 1
In AUDS packet configuration with layout 0 selected, the maximum number of active
channels is 2.

bit_ranges.name: CH_IN_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Each bit controls the enabling of the respective audio
channel. For instance, when bit 1 is set (1'b1) the audio
Channel 1 is enabled. When cleared, the referred channel
is disabled.

name: AHB_DMA_BUFFMASK
description: Audio DMA Buffer Mask Interrupt Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: MASK_FIFO_OVERRUN
bit_ranges.description: Buffer overrun flag mask

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: MASK_BUFF_FULL
bit_ranges.description: Buffer full flag mask

bit_ranges.name: MASK_BUFF_EMPTY
bit_ranges.description: Buffer empty flag mask

name: AHB_DMA_MASK1
description:
Audio DMA Mask Interrupt Register 1
This register masks interrupts present in the AHB audio DMA module.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_UNDERRUN_MASK
bit_ranges.description: AHB DMA FIFO underrun mask

bit_ranges.name: FIFO_OVERRUN_MASK
bit_ranges.description: AHB DMA FIFO overrun mask

name: AHB_DMA_STATUS
description: Audio DMA Status

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: AUTOSTART_STATUS
bit_ranges.description:
Indicates the set of start and stop addresses currently
used by the AHB audio DMA.
If cleared (1'b0), the start and stop addresses configured
in the address range 0x3604 to 0x360B are being used.
When set (1'b1), the configurations at address range
0x3620 to 0x3627 are being used.
This bit is always at zero when autostart_enable is
cleared (1'b0).

name: AHB_DMA_CONF2
description: Audio DMA Configuration Register 2

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: AUTOSTART_LOOP
bit_ranges.description: Enables the AHB audio DMA auto-start loop mode

bit_ranges.name: AUTOSTART_ENABLE
bit_ranges.description: Enables the AHB audio DMA auto-start feature

name: AHB_DMA_STRADDR_SET1[0:3]
description:
Audio DMA Start Address Set 1 Register Array Address offset: i = 0 to 3
These registers define the initial_addr_1[31:0] used to initiate the DMA burst read
transactions upon start_dma_transaction configuration.

bit_ranges.name: INITIAL_ADDR_1
bit_ranges.description:
Defines init_addr_1[7:0] to initiate DMA burst
transactions

name: AHB_DMA_STPADDR_SET1[0:3]
description:
Audio DMA Stop Address Set 1 Register Array Address offset: i = 0 to 3
These registers define the final_addr_1[31:0] used as the final point to the DMA burst read
transactions. Upon start_dma_transaction configuration, the DMA engine starts requesting
burst reads from the external system memory. Each burst read can have a maximum
theoretical length of 256 words (due to the AMBA AHB specification 1 Kbyte boundary burst
limitation).
The DMA engine is responsible for incrementing the burst starting address and defining its
corresponding burst length to reach the final_addr[31:0] address. The last burst request
issued by the DMA engine takes into account that it should only request data until the
final_addr[31:0] address (included) and for that should calculate the correct burst length.
After reaching the final_addr_1[31:0] address, the done interrupt is active to indicate
completion of the DMA operation.

bit_ranges.name: FINAL_ADDR_1
bit_ranges.description: Defines final_addr_1[7:0] to end DMA burst transactions

name: MC_CLKDIS
description: Main Controller Synchronous Clock Domain Disable Register

bit_ranges.name: H22SCLK_DISABLE
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP22 clock synchronous disable signal. When active
(1b), simultaneously bypasses HDCP22.

bit_ranges.name: HDCPCLK_DISABLE
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP clock synchronous disable signal. When active
(1b), simultaneously bypasses HDCP.

bit_ranges.name: CECCLK_DISABLE
bit_ranges.description: CEC Engine clock synchronous disable signal.

bit_ranges.name: CSCCLK_DISABLE
bit_ranges.description:
Color Space Converter clock synchronous disable
signal.

bit_ranges.name: AUDCLK_DISABLE
bit_ranges.description: Audio Sampler clock synchronous disable signal.

name: MC_SWRSTZREQ
description:
Main Controller Software Reset Register
Main controller software reset request per clock domain. Writing zero to a bit of this
register results in an NRZ signal toggle at sfrclk rate to an output signal that indicates a
software reset request. This toggle must be used to generate a synchronized reset to de
corresponding domain, with at least 1 clock cycle.

bit_ranges.name: IGPASWRST_REQ
bit_ranges.description:
GPAUD interface soft reset request. This bit is enabled
when the Generic Parallel Audio (GPAUD) interface is
enabled (AUDIO_IF = 6). Otherwise, this bit returns
zero.

bit_ranges.name: CECSWRST_REQ
bit_ranges.description:
CEC software reset request. Defaults back to 1b after
reset request. Note: After you configure cecswrst_req,
set the value of the bit csc_clk_disable of the register
mc_clkdis to 1, 0, and then 1 again.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: ISPDIFSWRST_REQ
bit_ranges.description: SPDIF audio software reset request.

bit_ranges.name: II2SSWRST_REQ
bit_ranges.description: I2S audio software reset request.

bit_ranges.name: PREPSWRST_REQ
bit_ranges.description: Pixel Repetition software reset request.

bit_ranges.name: TMDSSWRST_REQ
bit_ranges.description:
TMDS software reset request.
It is required to perform a write action on one of the
following registers:
fc_invidconf, fc_inhactiv0, fc_inhactiv1, fc_inhblank0,
fc_inhblank1, fc_invactiv0
fc_invactiv1, fc_invblank, fc_hsyncindelay0,
fc_hsyncindelay1, fc_hsyncinwidth0
fc_hsyncinwidth1, fc_vsyncindelay, fc_vsyncinwidth,
fc_ctrldur, fc_exctrldur, fc_exctrlspac

bit_ranges.name: PIXELSWRST_REQ
bit_ranges.description: Pixel software reset request.

name: MC_OPCTRL
description: Main Controller HDCP Bypass Control Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: H22S_OVR_VAL
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP SNPS 2.2 versus 1.4 switch override value
1'b0: The switch is routed to HDCP 1.4 signals when
hdcp22snps_switch_lock is not set to 1'b1.
1'b1: The switch is routed to HDCP 2.2 SNPS signals
when hdcp22snps_switch_lock is not set to 1'b1.

bit_ranges.name: H22S_SWITCH_LCK
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP 2.2 SNPS switch lock
1'b0: Enables you to change the direction of the HDCP
2.2 SNPS versus 1.4 switch by using the
hdcp22snps_ovr_val.
1'b1: You can still write to hdcp22snps_ovr_val but has
no effect over the HDCP 2.2 SNPS versus 1.4 switch,
that keeps as it was configured by hdcp22snps_ovr_val
at the time the 1'b1 was written to this bit field.
Once you set the value to 1'b1, you can change the
value back to 1'b0 only by issuing a master reset to the
Hdmi_tx.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_BLOCK_BYP
bit_ranges.description:
Block HDCP bypass mechanism
1'b0: This is the default value. You can write to the
hdcp_clkdisable bit of the register mc_clkdis and bypass
HDCP by acting on the register mc_clkdis bit 6
(hdcp_clkdisable)
1'b1: You can still write to the hdcp_clkdisable bit of the
register mc_clkdis but this action disables the HDCP
module and blocks the bypass mechanism. The output
data is frozen and the HDMI Tx and RX fail
authentication.
Once you set the value to 1'b1, you can change the
value back to 1'b0 only by issuing a master reset to the
Hdmi_tx. Otherwise, this field is a "spare" bit with no
associated functionality.

name: MC_FLOWCTRL
description: Main Controller Feed Through Control Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: FEED_THROUGH_OFF
bit_ranges.description:
Video path Feed Through enable bit:
1b: Color Space Converter is in the video data path.
0b: Color Space Converter is bypassed (not in the video
data path).

name: MC_PHYRSTZ
description: Main Controller PHY Reset Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: PHYRSTZ
bit_ranges.description:
HDMI Source PHY active low reset control for PHY GEN1,
active high reset control for PHY GEN2.

name: MC_LOCKONCLOCK
description: Main Controller Clock Present Register

bit_ranges.name: IGPACLK
bit_ranges.description:
GPAUD interface clock status. This bit is enabled when
the Generic Parallel Audio (GPAUD) interface is enabled
(AUDIO_IF = 6). Otherwise, this bit returns zero.
This bit indicates the clock is present in the system. It is
cleared by writing 1 to this bit.

bit_ranges.name: PCLK
bit_ranges.description:
Pixel clock status. Indicates that the clock is present in
the system. Cleared by WR 1 to this position.

bit_ranges.name: TCLK
bit_ranges.description:
TMDS clock status. Indicates that the clock is present in
the system. Cleared by WR 1 to this position.

bit_ranges.name: PREPCLK
bit_ranges.description:
Pixel Repetition clock status. Indicates that the clock is
present in the system. Cleared by WR 1 to this position.

bit_ranges.name: I2SCLK
bit_ranges.description:
I2S clock status. Indicates that the clock is present in the
system. Cleared by WR 1 to this position.

bit_ranges.name: AUDIOSPDIFCLK
bit_ranges.description:
SPDIF clock status. Indicates that the clock is present in
the system. Cleared by WR 1 to this position.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: CECCLK
bit_ranges.description:
CEC clock status. Indicates that the clock is present in
the system. Cleared by WR 1 to this position.

name: MC_HEACPHY_RST
description: Main Controller HEAC PHY Reset Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: HEACPHYRST
bit_ranges.description: HEAC PHY reset (active high)

name: MC_LOCKONCLOCK_2
description: Main Controller Clock Present Register 2

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: AHBDMACLK
bit_ranges.description:
AHB audio DMA clock status. Indicates that the clock is
present in the system. Cleared by WR 1 to this position.

name: MC_SWRSTZREQ_2
description:
Main Controller Software Reset Register 2
Main controller software reset request per clock domain. Writing zero to a bit of this
register results in a signal toggle that indicates a software reset request. This toggle is used
to generate a synchronized reset to the corresponding domain, with one or more clock
cycles.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: AHBDMASWRST_REQ
bit_ranges.description:
AHB audio DMA software reset request.
Writing 1'b1 does not result in any action.
Writing 1'b0 to this register resets all AHB audio logic.

name: MC_OPSTS
description:
Main Controller Status Register
This register contains the information regarding the status of the HDCP SNPS 2.2 versus
1.4 switch.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: H22S_SWITCH_STS
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP SNPS 2.2 versus 1.4 switch value status.
1'b0: HDCP 1.4 selected
1'b1: HDCP 2.2 selected

name: BASE_SFRDIVLOW
description: SFR Clock Base Time Register Low

bit_ranges.name: BASE_SFRDIV_LO
bit_ranges.description:
SFR clock divider Low
This register must be configured with the 8 least-
significant bits of the value sfrclk frequency divided by
1000 (for example, for 27 MHz base_sfrdiv[14:0] =
27027). The configured data is used to generate a
reference pulse of 1ms period that is needed by several
timers within the controller.

name: BASE_SFRDIVHIGH
description: SFR Clock Base Time Register High

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: BASE_SFRDIV_HI
bit_ranges.description:
SFR clock divider High
This register must be configured with the 7 most-
significant bits of the value sfrclk frequency divided by
1000 (for example, for 27 MHz base_sfrdiv[14:0]
= 27027). The configured data is used to generate a
reference pulse of 1ms period that is needed by several
timers within the controller.

name: CSC_CFG
description: Color Space Converter Interpolation and Decimation Configuration Register

bit_ranges.name: CSC_LIMIT
bit_ranges.description:
When set (1'b1), the range limitation values
defined in registers csc_mat_uplim and
csc_mat_dnlim are applied to the output of the
Color Space Conversion matrix. This feature
ensures that the video output range is always
respected, independently of the matrix coefficient
configuration or of the video input stream.

bit_ranges.name: SPARE_2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved as "spare" register with no associated
functionality.

bit_ranges.name: INTMODE
bit_ranges.description:
Chroma interpolation configuration:
intmode[1:0] | Chroma Interpolation
00 | interpolation disabled
01 | Hu (z) =1 + z^(-1)
10 | Hu(z)=1/ 2 + z^(-11)+1/2 z^(-2)
11 | interpolation disabled

bit_ranges.name: SPARE_1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved as "spare" register with no associated
functionality.

name: CSC_SCALE
description: Color Space Converter Scale and Deep Color Configuration Register

bit_ranges.name: CSC_COLOR_DEPTH
bit_ranges.description:
Color space converter color depth configuration:
csc_colordepth[3:0] | Action
0000 | 24 bit per pixel video (8 bit per
component).
0001-0011 | Reserved. Not used.
0100 | 24 bit per pixel video (8 bit per
component).
0101 | 30 bit per pixel video (10 bit per
component).
0110 | 36 bit per pixel video (12 bit per
component).
0111 | 48 bit per pixel video (16 bit per
component).
other | Reserved. Not used.

bit_ranges.name: SPARE
bit_ranges.description:
The is a Reserved as "spare" register with no
associated functionality.

bit_ranges.name: CSCSCALE
bit_ranges.description:
Defines the cscscale[1:0] scale factor to apply to all
coefficients in Color Space Conversion. This scale
factor is expressed in the number of left shifts to
apply to each of the coefficients, ranging from 0 to
2.

name: CSC_COEF_A1_MSB
description:
Color Space Converter Matrix A1 Coefficient Register MSB Notes:
The coefficients used in the CSC matrix use only 15 bits for the internal computations.
Coefficients are represented in 2's complementary format and stored in two registers:
csc_coef_*_lsb[7:0]: coefficient bits 7 to 0
csc_coef_*_msb[7]: spare bit
csc_coef_*_msb[6:0]: coefficient bits 14 to 8
Examples for standard ITU601 and ITU709 RGB/YCC conversion CSC coefficients exist in
the Video Datapath Application Note.

bit_ranges.name: CSC_COEF_A1_MSB
bit_ranges.description:
Color Space Converter Matrix A1 Coefficient
Register MSB

csc_coef_*_msb[7]: spare bit
csc_coef_*_msb[6:0]: coefficient bits 14 to 8

Color Space Converter Matrix B1 Coefficient Register MSB Color Space

Color Space Converter Matrix B1 Coefficient

name: A_HDCPCFG0
description: HDCP Enable and Functional Control Configuration Register 0

bit_ranges.name: ELVENA
bit_ranges.description:
Enables the Enhanced Link Verification from the
transmitter's side

bit_ranges.name: I2CFASTMODE
bit_ranges.description:
Enable the I2C fast mode option from the
transmitter's side.

bit_ranges.name: BYPENCRYPTION
bit_ranges.description: Bypasses all the data encryption stages

bit_ranges.name: SYNCRICHECK
bit_ranges.description:
Configures if the Ri check should be done at every
2s even or synchronously to every 128 encrypted
frame.

bit_ranges.name: AVMUTE
bit_ranges.description:
This register holds the current AVMUTE state of the
Hdmi_tx controller, as expected to be perceived by
the connected HDMI/HDCP sink device.

bit_ranges.name: RXDETECT
bit_ranges.description:
Information that a sink device was detected
connected to the HDMI port

bit_ranges.name: EN11FEATURE
bit_ranges.description:
Enable the use of features 1.1 from the
transmitter's side

bit_ranges.name: HDMIDVI
bit_ranges.description:
Configures the transmitter to operate with a HDMI
capable device or with a DVI device.

name: A_HDCPCFG1
description: HDCP Software Reset and Functional Control Configuration Register 1

bit_ranges.name: SPARE
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved as "spare" register with no associated
functionality.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_LOCK
bit_ranges.description:
Lock the HDCP bypass and encryption disable
mechanisms:
1'b0: The default 1'b0 value enables you to bypass
HDCP through bit 5 (bypencryption) of the
A_HDCPCFG0 register or to disable the encryption
through bit 1 (encryptiondisable) of A_HDCPCFG1.
1'b1: You can still write to the bit bypencryption of
A_HDCPCFG0 or encryptiondisable bit of
A_HDCPCFG1 but you cannot enable the bypass.
Once you set the value to 1'b1, you can change the
value back to 1'b0 only by issuing a master reset to
the Hdmi_tx.

bit_ranges.name: DISSHA1CHECK
bit_ranges.description:
Disables the request to the API processor to verify
the SHA1 message digest of a received KSV List

bit_ranges.name: PH2UPSHFTENC
bit_ranges.description:
Enables the encoding of packet header in the
tmdsch0 bit[0] with cipher[2] instead of the
tmdsch0 bit[2]
Note: This bit must always be set to 1 for all PHYs.

bit_ranges.name: ENCRYPTIONDISABLE
bit_ranges.description: Disable encryption without losing authentication

bit_ranges.name: SWRESET
bit_ranges.description:
Software reset signal, active by writing a zero and
auto cleared to 1 in the following cycle.

name: A_HDCPOBS0

bit_ranges.name: STATEA

Observability register informs in which state the
authentication machine is on.

bit_ranges.name: SUBSTATEA
bit_ranges.description:
Observability register informs in which sub-state
the authentication is on.

bit_ranges.name: HDCPENGAGED
bit_ranges.description:
Informs that the current HDMI link has the HDCP
protocol fully engaged.

name: A_HDCPOBS1

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED

OESS machine is on.

bit_ranges.name: STATER
bit_ranges.description:
Observability register informs in which state the

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: STATEE
bit_ranges.description:
Observability register informs in which state the
cipher machine is on.

bit_ranges.name: STATEEEG
bit_ranges.description:
Observability register informs in which state the
EESS machine is on.

name: A_HDCPOBS3
description: HDCP Observation Register 3

bit_ranges.name: HDMI_RESERVED_1
bit_ranges.description:
Register read from attached sink device:
Bcap(0x40) bit 7.

bit_ranges.name: REPEATER
bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.name: KSV_FIFO_READY
bit_ranges.description:
Register read from attached sink device:
Bcap(0x40) bit 5.

bit_ranges.name: FAST_I2C
bit_ranges.description:
Register read from attached sink device:
Bcap(0x40) bit 4.

bit_ranges.name: HDMI_RESERVED_2
bit_ranges.description:
Register read from attached sink device:
Bstatus(0x41) bit 13.

bit_ranges.name: HDMI_MODE
bit_ranges.description:
Register read from attached sink device:
Bstatus(0x41) bit 12.

bit_ranges.name: FEATURES_1_1
bit_ranges.description:
Register read from attached sink device:
Bcap(0x40) bit 1.

bit_ranges.name: FAST_REAUTHENTICATION
bit_ranges.description:

name: A_APIINTCLR
description:
HDCP Interrupt Clear Register
Write only register, active high and auto cleared, cleans the respective interruption in the
interrupt status register.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_ENGAGED
bit_ranges.description:
Clears the interruption related to HDCP
authentication process successful.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_FAILED
bit_ranges.description:
Clears the interruption related to HDCP
authentication process failed.

bit_ranges.name: KSVSHA1CALCDONEINT
bit_ranges.description:
Clears the interruption related to SHA1 verification
has been done

bit_ranges.name: I2CNACK
bit_ranges.description:
Clears the interruption related to I2C NACK
reception.

bit_ranges.name: LOSTARBITRATION
bit_ranges.description:
Clears the interruption related to I2C arbitration
lost.

bit_ranges.name: KEEPOUTERRORINT
bit_ranges.description:
Clears the interruption related to keep out window
error.

bit_ranges.name: KSVSHA1CALCINT
bit_ranges.description:
Clears the interruption related to KSV list update in
memory that needs to be SHA1 verified.

bit_ranges.name: KSVACCESSINT
bit_ranges.description:
Clears the interruption related to KSV Attr grant for
Read-Write access.

name: A_APIINTSTAT
description:
HDCP Interrupt Status Register
Read only register, reports the interruption which caused the activation of the interruption
output pin.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_ENGAGED
bit_ranges.description:
Notifies that the HDCP authentication process was
successful

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_FAILED
bit_ranges.description:
Notifies that the HDCP authentication process was
failed.

bit_ranges.name: KSVSHA1CALCDONEINT
bit_ranges.description:
Notifies that the HDCP13TCTRL controller SHA1
verification has been done. The status ready to be
read.

bit_ranges.name: I2CNACK
bit_ranges.description:
Notifies that the I2C received a NACK from slave
device.

bit_ranges.name: LOSTARBITRATION
bit_ranges.description:
Notifies that the I2C lost the arbitration to
communicate. Another master gained arbitration.

bit_ranges.name: KEEPOUTERRORINT
bit_ranges.description:
Notifies that during the keep out window, the
ctlout[3:0] bus was used besides control period.

bit_ranges.name: KSVSHA1CALCINT
bit_ranges.description:
Notifies that the HDCP13TCTRL controller as
updated a KSV list in memory that needs to be
SHA1 verified.

bit_ranges.name: KSVACCESSINT
bit_ranges.description:
Notifies that the KSV Attr as been guaranteed for
Read-Write access.

name: A_APIINTMSK
description:
HDCP Interrupt Mask Register
The configuration of this register mask a given setup of interruption, disabling them from
generating interruption pulses in the interruption output pin.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_ENGAGED
bit_ranges.description:
Masks the interruption related to HDCP
authentication process successful.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_FAILED
bit_ranges.description:
Masks the interruption related to HDCP
authentication process failed.

bit_ranges.name: KSVSHA1CALCDONEINT
bit_ranges.description:
Masks the interruption related to SHA1 verification
has been done Otherwise, this field is a "spare" bit
with no associated functionality.

bit_ranges.name: I2CNACK
bit_ranges.description:
Masks the interruption related to I2C NACK
reception.

bit_ranges.name: LOSTARBITRATION
bit_ranges.description:
Masks the interruption related to I2C arbitration
lost.

bit_ranges.name: KEEPOUTERRORINT
bit_ranges.description:
Masks the interruption related to keep out window
error.

bit_ranges.name: KSVSHA1CALCINT
bit_ranges.description:
Masks the interruption related to KSV list update in
memory that needs to be SHA1 verified. Otherwise,
this field is a "spare" bit with no associated
functionality.

bit_ranges.name: KSVACCESSINT
bit_ranges.description:
Masks the interruption related to KSV Attr grant for
Read-Write access.

bit_ranges.name: SPARE_2
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved as "spare" bit with no associated

bit_ranges.name: HSYNCPOL
bit_ranges.description:
Configuration of the video Horizontal synchronism

bit_ranges.name: SPARE_1
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved as "spare" bit with no associated
functionality.

name: A_OESSWCFG
description:
HDCP OESS WOO Configuration Register
Pulse width of the encryption enable (CTL3) signal in the HDCP OESS mode. The window of
opportunity for the Original Encryption Status Signaling starts at the active edge of the
Vertical synchronism and stops after oesswindowoffset[7:0]*4 clock cycles of TMDS clock.
According to the HDCP specification, the CTL3 signal must be asserted at least for eight
TMDS clock cycles (oesswindowoffset[7:0] must be greater than 1), and it is recommended
to transmit a larger pulse width for enhanced link reliability.

bit_ranges.name: A_OESSWCFG
bit_ranges.description: HDCP OESS WOO Configuration Register

name: A_COREVERLSB
description: HDCP Controller Version Register LSB Design ID number.

bit_ranges.name: A_COREVERLSB
bit_ranges.description: HDCP Controller Version Register LSB

name: A_COREVERMSB
description: HDCP Controller Version Register MSB Revision ID number.

bit_ranges.name: A_COREVERMSB
bit_ranges.description: HDCP Controller Version Register MSB

name: A_KSVMEMCTRL
description:
HDCP KSV Memory Control Register
The KSVCTRLupd bit is a notification flag. This flag changes polarity whenever the register
is written. This flag acts as a trigger to other blocks that processes this data. Upon reset
the flag returns to low default value.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: KSVSHA1STATUS
bit_ranges.description:
Notification whether the KSV list message digest is
correct from the controller: 1'b1 if digest message
verification failed 1'b0 if digest message verification
succeeded

bit_ranges.name: SHA1FAIL
bit_ranges.description:
Notification whether the KSV list message digest is
correct.

bit_ranges.name: KSVCTRLUPD
bit_ranges.description:
Set to inform that the KSV list in memory has been
analyzed and the response to the Message Digest
has been updated if on configurations on software
SHA-1 calculation.

bit_ranges.name: KSVMEMACCESS
bit_ranges.description: Notification that the KSV Attr as been guaranteed.

bit_ranges.name: KSVMEMREQUEST
bit_ranges.description:
Request access to the KSV memory; must be de-
asserted after the access is completed by the
system.

name: HDCP_BSTATUS[0:1]
description: HDCP BStatus Register Array

bit_ranges.name: BSTATUS
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP BSTATUS[15:0]. If Attr has not been granted
(see register a_ksvmemctrl), the value read will be
8'hff.

name: HDCP_M0[0:7]
description: HDCP M0 Register Array

bit_ranges.name: M0
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP M0[32:0]. If Attr has not been granted (see
register a_ksvmemctrl) , the value read will be
8'hff. These values are only available on a
configuration that has the SHA1 calculation by
software.

name: HDCP_KSV[0:634]
description: HDCP KSV Registers.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_KSV_BYTE
bit_ranges.description:
Sink KSV FIFO byte, ordered in little endian (byte at
address 0x502a belongs to byte 0 of KSV0). If Attr
has not been granted (see register a_ksvmemctrl),
the value read is 8'hff.
In this address space, 635 KSV FIFO bytes are
mapped, which allow for 127 KSV values, each with
5 bytes (40 bits).

name: HDCP_VH[0:19]
description: HDCP SHA-1 VH Registers.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_VH_BYTE
bit_ranges.description:
Sink VH' byte, ordered in little endian (byte at
address 0x525a belongs to byte 0 of VH0). If Attr
has not been granted (see register a_ksvmemctrl),
the value read is 8'hff.
In this address space 20 VH bytes are mapped,
which allow for 5 VH values, each with 4 bytes
(32bits).

name: HDCP_REVOC_SIZE_0
description: HDCP Revocation KSV List Size Register 0

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_REVOC_SIZE_0
bit_ranges.description:
Register containing the LSB of KSV list size
(ksv_list_size[7:0]). If Attr has not been granted
(see register a_ksvmemctrl), the value read is 8'hff.

name: HDCP_REVOC_SIZE_1
description: HDCP Revocation KSV List Size Register 1

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_REVOC_SIZE_1
bit_ranges.description:
Register containing the MSB of KSV list size
(ksv_list_size[15:8]). If Attr has not been granted
(see register a_ksvmemctrl), the value read is 8'hff.

name: HDCP_REVOC_LIST[0:5059]
description: HDCP Revocation KSV Registers.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP_REVOC_LIST_KSV_BYTE
bit_ranges.description:
Revocation KSV byte, ordered in little endian (byte
at address 0x52bb belongs to byte 0 of the first
revoked KSV). If Attr has not been granted (see
register a_ksvmemctrl), the value read is 8'hff.
In this address space 5060 revoked KSV bytes are
mapped, which allow for 1012 KSV values, each
with 5 bytes (40 bits).

bit_ranges.name: HDCPREG_BKSV0

When oanbypass=0, the value of AN used in the
