name: HDCPREG_RMLCTL
description:
HDCP Encrypted Device Private Keys Control Register
This register is the control register for the software programmable encrypted DPK
embedded storage feature. The required software configuration sequence is documented in
the Cores HDMI Transmitter User Guide in the "Programming" chapter, Section 3.2.4,
"Configure HDCP."

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: ODPK_DECRYPT_ENABLE
bit_ranges.description:
When set (1'b1), this bit activates the decryption of
the Device Private keys.

name: HDCPREG_RMLSTS
description:
HDCP Encrypted DPK Status Register
The required software configuration sequence is documented in the Cores HDMI
Transmitter User Guide in the "Programming" chapter, Section 3.2.4, "Configure HDCP."

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: IDPK_WR_OK_STS
bit_ranges.description:
When high (1'b1), it indicates that a DPK write is
allowed.

bit_ranges.name: IDPK_DATA_INDEX
bit_ranges.description:
Current Device Private Key being written plus one.
Position 0 is occupied by the AKSV.

name: HDCPREG_SEED0
description:
HDCP Encrypted DPK Seed Register 0
This register contains a byte of the HDCP Encrypted DPK seed value used to encrypt the
Device Private Keys. The required software configuration sequence is documented in the
Cores HDMI Transmitter User Guide in the "Programming" chapter, Section 3.2.4,
"Configure HDCP."

bit_ranges.name: HDCPREG_SEED0
bit_ranges.description:
Least significant byte of the decryption seed value
(dpk_decrypt_seed[7:0]).

name: HDCPREG_SEED1
description:
HDCP Encrypted DPK Seed Register 1
This register contains a byte of the HDCP Encrypted DPK seed value used to encrypt the
Device Private Keys. The required software configuration sequence is documented in the
Cores HDMI Transmitter User Guide in the "Programming" chapter, Section 3.2.4,
"Configure HDCP."

bit_ranges.name: HDCPREG_SEED1
bit_ranges.description:
Most significant byte of the decryption seed value
(dpk_decrypt_seed[15:8]).

name: HDCPREG_DPK0
description:
HDCP Encrypted DPK Data Register 0
This register contains an HDCP DPK byte. The required software configuration sequence is
documented in the Cores HDMI Transmitter User Guide in the "Programming" chapter,
Section 3.2.4, "Configure HDCP."

bit_ranges.name: DPK_DATA
bit_ranges.description:
Byte of the encrypted DPK value. dpk[7:0]
When this byte is written, a strobe signal is
generated that triggers the decryption and/or
storage of the DPK word on the DPK internal RAM
memory.

name: HDCPREG_DPK1
description:
HDCP Encrypted DPK Data Register 1
This register contains an HDCP DPK byte. The required software configuration sequence is
documented in the Cores HDMI Transmitter User Guide in the "Programming" chapter,
Section 3.2.4, "Configure HDCP."

bit_ranges.name: DPK_DATA
bit_ranges.description: Byte of the encrypted DPK value. dpk[15:8]

name: HDCPREG_DPK2
description:
HDCP Encrypted DPK Data Register 2
This register contains an HDCP DPK byte. The required software configuration sequence is
documented in the Cores HDMI Transmitter User Guide in the "Programming" chapter,
Section 3.2.4, "Configure HDCP."

bit_ranges.name: DPK_DATA
bit_ranges.description: Byte of the encrypted DPK value. dpk[23:16]

name: HDCPREG_DPK3
description:
HDCP Encrypted DPK Data Register 3
This register contains an HDCP DPK byte. The required software configuration sequence is
documented in the Cores HDMI Transmitter User Guide in the "Programming" chapter,

name: HDCP22REG_CTRL
description: HDCP 2.2 Control Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: HPD_OVR_VAL
bit_ranges.description:
HPD Override Value
1'b0: If hpd_ovr_en is 1'b1 the HPD value to the
HDCP 2.2 external interface is set to 1'b0.
1'b1: If hpd_ovr_en is 1'b1 the HPD value to the
HDCP 2.2 external interface is set to 1'b1.

bit_ranges.name: HPD_OVR_EN
bit_ranges.description:
HPD Override enable
1'b0: The HPD value to the HDCP 2.2 external
interface comes from the PHY as in phy_stat0.HPD.
1'b1: The HPD value to the HDCP 2.2 external
interface comes from hpd_ovr_val bit field.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP22_OVR_VAL
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP 2.2 versus 1.4 switch override value
1'b0: The switch is routed to HDCP 1.4 signals when
hdcp22_ovr_en is 1'b1 and hdcp22_switch_lock is
not set to 1'b1.
1'b1: The switch is routed to HDCP 2.2 signals when
hdcp22_ovr_en is 1'b1 and hdcp22_switch_lock is
not set to 1'b1.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP22_OVR_EN
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP 2.2 versus 1.4 switch override enable
1'b0: The switch is automatically controlled by the
HDCP 2.2 controller using the ist_hdcp2_capable
and ist_hdcp2_not_capable status level indications.
If the HDCP 2.2 controller indicates
ist_hdcp2_capable at 1'b1, the switch is routed to
HDCP 2.2 signals. If the HDCP 2.2 controller
indicates ist_hdcp2_not_capable at 1'b1, the switch
is routed to HDCP 1.4 signals.
1'b1: The HDCP 2.2 ist_hdcp2_capable and
ist_hdcp2_not_capable values are ignored, and the
direction of the HDCP 2.2 versus 1.4 switch is
directly controlled by the hdcp22_ovr_val.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP22_SWITCH_LCK
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP 2.2 switch lock
1'b0: Enables you to change the direction of the
HDCP 2.2 versus
1.4 switch by using the hdcp22_ovr_en and
hdcp22_ovr_val.
1'b1: You can still write to hdcp22_ovr_en and
hdcp22_ovr_val but has no effect over the HDCP 2.2
versus 1.4 switch, that keeps as it was configured
by hdcp22_ovr_en and hdcp22_ovr_val at the time
the 1'b1 was written to this bit field.
Once you set the value to 1'b1, you can change the
value back to 1'b0 only by issuing a master reset to
the Hdmi_tx.

name: HDCP22REG_CTRL1
description: HDCP 2.2 Control Register 1

bit_ranges.name: HDCP22_CD_OVR_VAL
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP color depth override value, which is sent
through the HDCP
2.2 external interface when
hdcp22reg_ctrl1.hdcp22_cd_ovr_en is set.
For reference on the HDMI allowed values consult
the HDMI 1.4b specification, Table 6-1.

bit_ranges.name: HDCP22_CD_OVR_EN
bit_ranges.description:
HDCP 2.2 versus 1.4 color depth override enable:
1'b0: The default 1'b0 value indicates that the color
depth sent to the external interface is the one
configured in the vp_pr_cd.color_depth register
field.
1'b1: Although the used color depth for pixel
encoding is defined by the field
vp_pr_cd.color_depth register, the color depth sent
to the external interface is the one defined in
register field hdcp22reg_ctrl1.hdcp22_cd_ovr_val.

name: CEC_CTRL
description:
CEC Control Register
This register handles the main control of the CEC initiator.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: STANDBY
bit_ranges.description:
1: CEC controller responds with a NACK to all
messages and generates a wakeup status for opcode.
It only responds with a NACK when the EOM is
received. This means only the last block of a frame
responds with NACK. The follower sends an ACK to
the message when there is only one head block
pointed to the follower, if the follower is in the
standby mode.
0: CEC controller responds the ACK to all messages.

bit_ranges.name: BC_NACK
bit_ranges.description:
1'b1: Set by software to NACK the received broadcast
message. This bit holds until software resets. The
broadcasts is answered with 1'b0, indicating the
follower reject the message.
1'b0: Reset by software to ACK the received
broadcast message.

bit_ranges.name: FRAME_TYP
bit_ranges.description:
2'b00: Signal Free Time = 3-bit periods. Previous
attempt to send frame is unsuccessful.
2'b01: Signal Free Time = 5-bit periods. New initiator
wants to send a frame.
2'b10: Signal Free Time = 7-bit periods. Present
initiator wants to send another frame immediately
after its previous frame. (specification CEC 9.1).
2'b11: Illegal value. If software writes this value,
hardware sets the value to the default 2'b01.

name: CEC_MASK
description:
CEC Interrupt Mask Register
This read/write register masks/unmasks the interrupt events. When the bit is set to 1
(masked), the corresponding event does not trigger an interrupt signal at the system
interface. When the bit is reset to 0, the interrupt event is unmasked.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: WAKEUP
bit_ranges.description: Follower wake-up signal mask

bit_ranges.name: ERROR_FLOW
bit_ranges.description:
An error is notified by a follower. Abnormal logic data
bit error (for follower)

bit_ranges.name: ERROR_INITIATOR
bit_ranges.description: An error is detected on a CEC line (for initiator only).

bit_ranges.name: ARB_LOST
bit_ranges.description:
The initiator losses the CEC line arbitration to a second
initiator. (specification CEC 9)

bit_ranges.name: NACK
bit_ranges.description:
A frame is not acknowledged in a directly addressed
message. Or a frame is negatively acknowledged in a
broadcast message (for initiator only)

bit_ranges.name: EOM
bit_ranges.description:
EOM is detected so that the received data is ready in
the receiver data buffer (for follower only)

bit_ranges.name: DONE
bit_ranges.description:
The current transmission is successful (for initiator
only)

name: CEC_ADDR_L
description:
CEC Logical Address Register Low
This register indicates the logical address(es) allocated to the CEC device.
This register is written by software when the logical allocation is finished. Bit value 1 means
the corresponding logical address is allocated to this device. Bit value 0 means the
corresponding logical address is not allocated to this device.

bit_ranges.description: Logical address 7 - Tuner 3

bit_ranges.name: CEC_ADDR_L_6

bit_ranges.description: Logical address 5 - Audio System

bit_ranges.description: Logical address 4 - Playback Device 1

bit_ranges.name: CEC_ADDR_L_3
bit_ranges.description: Logical address 3 - Tuner 1

bit_ranges.name: CEC_ADDR_L_2
bit_ranges.description: Logical address 2 - Recording Device 2

bit_ranges.name: CEC_ADDR_L_1
bit_ranges.description: Logical address 1 - Recording Device 1

bit_ranges.name: CEC_ADDR_L_0
bit_ranges.description: Logical address 0 - Device TV

name: CEC_ADDR_H
description:
CEC Logical Address Register High
This register indicates the logical address(es) allocated to the CEC device.
This register is written by software when the logical allocation is finished. Bit value 1 means
the corresponding logical address is allocated to this device. Bit value 0 means the
corresponding logical address is not allocated to this device.

bit_ranges.name: CEC_ADDR_H_7
bit_ranges.description:
Logical address 15 - Unregistered (as initiator
address), Broadcast (as destination address)

bit_ranges.name: CEC_ADDR_H_6
bit_ranges.description: Logical address 14 - Free use

bit_ranges.name: CEC_ADDR_H_5
bit_ranges.description: Logical address 13 - Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CEC_ADDR_H_4
bit_ranges.description: Logical address 12 - Reserved

bit_ranges.description: Logical address 9 - Playback Device 3

bit_ranges.name: CEC_ADDR_H_0
bit_ranges.description: Logical address 8 - Playback Device 2

name: CEC_TX_CNT
description:
CEC TX Frame Size Register
This register indicates the size of the frame in bytes (including header and data blocks),
which are available in the transmitter data buffer.
Note: When the value is zero, the CEC controller ignores the send command triggered by
software. When the transmission is done (no matter success or not), the current value is
held until it is overwritten by software.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: CEC_TX_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
CEC Transmitter Counter register 5'd0: No data needs
to be transmitted 5'd1: Frame size is 1 byte
5'd16: Frame size is 16 bytes

name: CEC_RX_CNT
description:
CEC RX Frame Size Register
This register indicates the size of the frame in bytes (including header and data blocks),
which are available in the receiver data buffer.
Note: Only after the whole receiving process is finished successfully, the counter is
refreshed to the value which indicates the total number of data bytes in the Receiver Data
Register.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: CEC_RX_CNT
bit_ranges.description:
CEC Receiver Counter register: 
5'd0: No data received
5'd1: 1-byte data is received
5'd16: 16-byte data is received

name: CEC_TX_DATA[0:15]
description:
CEC TX Data Register Array Address offset: i = 0 to 15
These registers (8 bits each) are the buffers used for storing the data waiting for
transmission (including header and data blocks).

bit_ranges.name: DATABYTE
bit_ranges.description: Data byte[x], where x is 0 to 15

name: CEC_RX_DATA[0:15]
description:
CEC RX Data Register Array Address offset: i =0 to 15
These registers (8 bit each) are the buffers used for storing the received data (including
header and data blocks).

bit_ranges.name: DATABYTE
bit_ranges.description: Data byte[x], where x is 0 to 15

name: CEC_LOCK
description: CEC Buffer Lock Register

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: LOCKED_BUFFER
bit_ranges.description:
When a frame is received, this bit would be active. The
CEC controller answers to all the messages with NACK
until the CPU writes it to '0'.

name: CEC_WAKEUPCTRL
description:
CEC Wake-up Control Register
After receiving a message in the CEC_RX_DATA1 (OPCODE) registers, the CEC engine
verifies the message opcode[7:0] against one of the previously defined values to generate
the wake-up status:
Wakeupstatus is 1 when:
received opcode is 0x04 and opcode0x04en is 1 or
received opcode is 0x0D and opcode0x0Den is 1 or
received opcode is 0x41 and opcode0x41en is 1 or
received opcode is 0x42 and opcode0x42en is 1 or
received opcode is 0x44 and opcode0x44en is 1 or
received opcode is 0x70 and opcode0x70en is 1 or
received opcode is 0x82 and opcode0x82en is 1 or
received opcode is 0x86 and opcode0x86en is 1
Wakeupstatus is 0 when none of the previous conditions are true.
This formula means that the wake-up status (on CEC_STAT[6] register) is only '1' if the
opcode[7:0] received is equal to one of the defined values and the corresponding enable bit
of that defined value is set to '1'.

bit_ranges.name: OPCODE0X86EN
bit_ranges.description: OPCODE 0x86 wake up enable

bit_ranges.name: OPCODE0X82EN
bit_ranges.description: OPCODE 0x82 wake up enable

bit_ranges.name: OPCODE0X70EN
bit_ranges.description: OPCODE 0x70 wake up enable

bit_ranges.name: OPCODE0X44EN
bit_ranges.description: OPCODE 0x44 wake up enable

bit_ranges.name: OPCODE0X42EN
bit_ranges.description: OPCODE 0x42 wake up enable

bit_ranges.name: OPCODE0X41EN
bit_ranges.description: OPCODE 0x41 wake up enable

bit_ranges.name: OPCODE0X0DEN
bit_ranges.description: OPCODE 0x0D wake up enable

bit_ranges.name: OPCODE0X04EN
bit_ranges.description: OPCODE 0x04 wake up enable

name: I2CM_SDA_HOLD
description: I2C DDC SDA Hold Register

bit_ranges.name: OSDA_HOLD
bit_ranges.description:
Defines the number of SFR clock cycles to meet
tHD;DAT (300 ns) osda_hold =
round_to_high_integer (300 ns / (1 /
isfrclk_frequency))

name: I2CM_SCDC_READ_UPDATE
description:
SCDC Control Register
This register configures the SCDC update status read through the I2C master interface.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: UPDTRD_VSYNCPOLL_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Update read polling enabled. When active (1'b1), an
SCDC Update Read is performed at the fall of the
active edge of the vertical sync pulse.

bit_ranges.name: READ_REQUEST_EN
bit_ranges.description:
Read request enabled. When active (1'b1) an SCDC
Update Read shall be performed whenever a SCDC
read request is detected.

bit_ranges.name: RESERVED
bit_ranges.description: Reserved for future use.

bit_ranges.name: READ_UPDATE
bit_ranges.description:
When set to 1'b1, a SCDC Update Read is performed
and the read data loaded into registers
i2cm_scdc_update0 and i2cm_scdc_update1.
